title: Is matchmaking a bit goofy for anyone else right now?
body:
Title.

I'm a bronze 4 (and reckon there's where I belong atm), and I keep getting into norm games alongside silvers and low golds.

Now I'm all for getting a good beatdown every now and then to keep me humble, but when I keep matching up with people considerably better than me and getting consistently stomped in lane the shine kind of wears off a bit.

This might just be a vent but is anyone else getting weird matchups at the moment?

replies.body: Im Bronze 1, get matched with plat's and diamonds (in norms) stop complaining lol, accept it as a challenge not as riot fucking up (again)
implying normals takes ranked mmr into consideration
Norms and ranked have separate MMRs yeah?
You think people would understand this by now........................

Yeah I've seen heaps of posts in the last few weeks on this topic. In my ARAMs I'm being matched with teams that are mostly gold, despite being unranked, and recently in a ranked game I was supporting a platinum Ezreal on a team of golds. 
The mid laners hit level 15 when I was level 9. I didn't belong in that game and I just got abused for about half an hour.
I'm happy to just play with bronze players, ty xD

Also, fun fact. Platinum Ezreals can flame WHILE they cs. Truly impressive shit.

Getting matched with people out of your league can happen for a whole bunch of reasons, but in this case I suspect it's because you are duoing frequently with Platinum 5, Gold 5, Silver 1, and Silver 3 players.
You know what, that actually makes a lot of sense

Had a few games lately with unranked people doing their provisional games. I'm only Gold 3, but clearly these guys were way in above their head.

For example. I had an unranked lvl 30 player, fresh account, didn't play last season. Had lost 6 of their past 7 games (all provisional) yet was still paired against high golds and a couple of plats from memory. And my MMR for soloQ is normal.

I really don't think it's fair on the ranked and also the unranked players doing their provisionals chucking them in the deep end and seeing if they sink or swim. These guys were clearly playing in games well above what they should be in and it reflected in a loss for the teams. I'm not blaming them purely, but it's hard to play with people still learning the basic fundamentals of the game.
well you could either have high personal mmr or they have low personal mmr. both very likely at this point in the season. what the system cares about is team average mmr anyway
